entry.title: William Miller Beardshear (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that William Miller Beardshear (pictured) was known as the "father of Iowa State College", now known as Iowa State University?

entry.title: the oldest Chinese medical text on surgery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the oldest Chinese medical text on surgery was, according to tradition, written by a doctor who had met a ghost?

entry.title: sports podcasts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that listeners to ESPN's sports podcasts are "13 years younger than" ESPN Radio listeners, according to a company executive?

entry.title: Sir Srinivas Varadachariar (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Sir Srinivas Varadachariar was the first Indian chief justice of the Federal Court of India?

entry.title: Fort Curtis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fort Curtis's 24-pounder guns were taken away for use in the Vicksburg campaign?

entry.title: Abish (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in the Book of Mormon's allusion to the raising of Lazarus of Bethany in John 11, Abish plays a role parallel to that of Jesus?

entry.title: Ghost of Tsushima (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the setting of the game Ghost of Tsushima takes place during the Mongol invasion of Tsushima?

entry.title: Daniel Larsen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that mathematician Daniel Larsen was the youngest contributor to the New York Times crossword puzzle?
